devdoc.author: Jesús Lanchas
devdoc.details: All outcome values in transaction methods are included in events

params.newAdmin: The address that we want to include as Admin in the contract

params.availableNumItems: The number of items available to sell
params.name: The name of the item to create
params.price: The unitary price of the item to create
params.sku: The SKU of the item to create. Important: this field is not editable
params.storeId: The store id where we want to add a new item

params.newSeller: The address that we want to add as seller

addStore(string).details: The storeId is generated internally with keccak256. Event emitted: StoreCreated

params.name: The name to set to the created store

params.availableNumItems: The new available amount to set in the item
params.name: The new name to set in the item
params.price: The new price to set in the item
params.sku: The sku of the item to update
params.storeId: The storeId where the item to update is located

getItemMetadata(address,bytes32,uint256).details: The return values will have default values if the item, the store or the seller don't exist

params.seller: The owner of the item whose metadata we want to get
params.sku: The sku of the item whose metadata we want to get
params.storeId: The id of the store were the item is located

getItemMetadata(address,bytes32,uint256).return: The name, price and availableNumItems attributes of the item

getNumberOfItems(address,bytes32).details: It will return zero if the seller or the store don't exist

params.seller: The address of the seller to consider
params.storeId: The id of the store to consider

getNumberOfItems(address,bytes32).return: The number of items in the store

getNumberOfSellers().details: It's based on the array of sellers, not in the pending funds
getNumberOfSellers().return: The number of sellers in the contract

params.seller: The address whose number of stores we want to get

getNumberOfStores(address).return: The number of stores of the seller passed as parameter

getPendingFunds().return: the value, in wei, pending for the sender

getRole().details: A no privileged user is considered a buyer. Owner is not a role in the contract
getRole().return: The enum value of Roles associated with the sender of the message

params.sellerIndex: The index of the seller whose address we want to get

getSellerAddress(uint256).return: The seller address in position sellerIndex

getSku(address,bytes32,uint256).details: It'll return zero if the item, the store, or the seller don't exist

params.skuIndex: The position of the item in the array of items associated with the store
params.storeId: The id of the store where the item is located

params.seller: The address of the store's owner whose id we want to get
params.storeIndex: The index of the store, among the stores of the owner, whose storeId we want to get

params.seller: The address of the store's owner whose metadata we want to get
params.storeId: The store id of te store whose metadata we want to get

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

purchaseItem(address,bytes32,uint256,uin.details: msg.value must be exactly equals to item.price * numPurchasedItems. The funds will be avaiable to the seller (Withdrawal pattern)

params.numPurchasedItems: The number of items to purchase. It must be greater than the available number of items
params.seller: The owner of the item to purchase
params.sku: The sku of the item to purchase
params.storeId: The id of the store where the item is located

params.oldAdmin: The address that we want to remove from the list of admins

params.sku: The sku of the item to remove
params.storeId: The id of the store where the item to remove is located

removeSeller(uint256).details: This operation changes the order in the sellers array. Event emitted: SellerRemoved

params.sellerIndex: The index of the seller in the array of sellers, of the seller that we want to remove

removeStore(bytes32,uint256).details: empire.storesIds[storeIndex] must be equals to storeId. The only reason to accept the two params is efficiency.Store's items are deleted in a for-loop, so if the number of items is too high this could be an issue. For that reason we limit the number of items in a store to `MAX_ITEMS_PER_STORE`

params.storeId: The id of the store to remove
params.storeIndex: The index of the store, in the array of stores, that we want to remove

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

withdraw().details: Nothing is executed after transfer the value, to avoid reentrancy

devdoc.title: Marketplace contract to sell, buy and withdraw funds

addAdmin(address).notice: Add the address `newAdmin` in the list of admins

addItem(bytes32,uint256,string,uint256,u.notice: Create and add a new item in the store whose storeId is passed as parameter

addSeller(address).notice: Add the address `newAddress` to the list of valid sellers

addStore(string).notice: Add a new store associated to the addres `msg.sender`, with name `name`

editItem(bytes32,uint256,string,uint256,.notice: Update the item in the store with storeId `storeId` and whose sku is `sku`

getItemMetadata(address,bytes32,uint256).notice: Return the metadata associated with the sku `sku`, in the store `storeId`, of the seller `seller`

getNumberOfItems(address,bytes32).notice: Return the number of items from the seller `seller` in the store `storeId`

getNumberOfSellers().notice: Return the number of sellers in the contract

getNumberOfStores(address).notice: Return the number of stores associated with the address `seller`

getPendingFunds().notice: Return the value of pending funds associated with `msg.sender`

getRole().notice: Getting the current role of the sender in the contract

getSellerAddress(uint256).notice: Return the address of seller set in the position `sellerIndex`

getSku(address,bytes32,uint256).notice: Return the SKU of the item set in the position `skuIndex`, in the store with id `storeId` of the seller `seller`

getStoreId(address,uint256).notice: Return the storeId of the store of `seller` set in position `storeIndex`

getStoreMetadata(address,bytes32).notice: Returns the name of the store and the number of items in it

purchaseItem(address,bytes32,uint256,uin.notice: Purchase `numPurchasedItems` items with sku `sku`, in the store with id `storeId`, of the seller `seller`. It expects the exact value.

removeAdmin(address).notice: Remove the addres `oldAdmin` from the list of valid admins

removeItem(bytes32,uint256).notice: Remove the item with sku `sku` from a store with id `storeId`

removeSeller(uint256).notice: Remove the seller set at index `sellerIndex` as seller in the contract, transforming it into a buyer. The pending funds will be kept.

removeStore(bytes32,uint256).notice: Remove the store with storeId `storeId`, set in position `storeIndex`.

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

toggleContractActive().notice: Toggle the emergency state of the contract. Only the owner can do this

withdraw().notice: Withdraw funds from the contract to `msg.sender`, considering the pending funds saved in the contact

userdoc.notice: This contract belongs to a final project in the Developer Program 2018 @ Consensys Academy
